email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry - Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. I’m reaching out regarding your inquiry for a crude oil shipment from Houston to Rotterdam. We have a suitable vessel, the MV Ocean Star, with a DWT of 150,000 and an LOA of 280 meters. The laycan is 15-20 October. Our starting freight quote is in the low 50s, specifically $50.75 per metric ton. Let me know if this works for you or if you’d like to discuss further. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry - Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the quick response. The vessel details look good, but the freight rate is a bit higher than we were hoping for. Could you consider $49.50 per metric ton? Also, can you confirm the demurrage rate? Looking forward to your reply. Cheers, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry - Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your feedback. I understand your position, but $49.50 is a bit tight given current market conditions. However, I can offer $50.25 per metric ton as a middle ground. The demurrage rate is $20,000 per day, pro rata. Let me know if this works for you. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry - Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the revised offer. $50.25 is acceptable, but could we lock in the laycan as 16-19 October to minimize demurrage risk? Also, please confirm the cargo size is 140,000 metric tons. Looking forward to finalizing this. Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry - Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I’m glad we’re close to an agreement. Yes, the cargo size is 140,000 metric tons, and I can confirm the laycan as 16-19 October. I’ll prepare the charter party agreement with the agreed terms: $50.25 per metric ton and demurrage at $20,000 per day. Let me know if there’s anything else before I send it over. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry - Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, everything looks good. Please proceed with the charter party agreement. Thanks for your flexibility on the laycan and freight rate. Looking forward to working with you on this shipment. Cheers, John
